thread.title: All Blacks beat South Africa to reach Rugby World Cup final
thread.title_full: All Blacks beat South Africa to reach Rugby World Cup final

author: FOSTER NIUMATA
title: All Blacks beat South Africa to reach Rugby World Cup final
text:
Sports All Blacks beat South Africa to reach Rugby World Cup final New Zealand’s Beauden Barrett, right, competes for the ball with South Africa’s Willie Le Roux during the Rugby World Cup semifinal match between South Africa and New Zealand at Twickenham Stadium, London, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015. (AP Photo/Kirsty Wigglesworth) more > By FOSTER NIUMATA -   
LONDON (AP) - New Zealand advanced its Rugby World Cup title defense to the final by overcoming archrival South Africa 20-18 in the wet at Twickenham on Saturday. 
The hype around this first World Cup matchup in 12 years between the teams that have combined to win four titles was exceeded as they wrestled in an atmosphere thick with tension. 
Despite both teams enjoying advantages in key areas, they managed to cancel out each other’s edge. 
The All Blacks enjoyed a majority of possession and territory, but the Springboks tackled to a standstill. 
The All Blacks scored two tries, but their ill-discipline gave the Springboks six kicked penalties. 
The All Blacks stole four lineouts, but the Springboks earned a scrum tighthead and vital scrum penalties. 
The All Blacks had a man sin-binned and conceded three points. South Africa had a man sin-binned and conceded only three, too. 
In the last minute, it was the All Blacks who put up a wall as the South Africans tried to run out of their 22 and still could find no way through, their hopes of a third cup triumph washed away with a last knock-on.
